value.title: Test your Power BI DAX measures in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Learn how to get your DAX measures in working order, using DAX Studio, before putting them in your Power BI report. Patrick walks you through it!  SQLBI article: https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/hiding-future-dates-for-calculations-in-dax/  Hiding Future Dates video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VXd1wl-5vKI

value.title: The Case of the Scribble Line Chart in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at a funky line chart and how it got to be that way. This is a live tile within a Power BI Dashboard based on a streaming dataset. Microsoft Flow is pushing data from Twitter into the Power BI Streaming Dataset.  Brian Gregor brought this to Adam's attention and helped setup

value.title: The Conceptual Data Model and Limits
value.excerpt: A look at the data model from a file perspective.  The Excel Workbook or PBIX file is not the data model, but just a container that the Model is inside of.  I also revisit limits on the size.  http://blogs.technet.com/b/powerbisupport/archive/2015/08/11/the-conceptual-data-model-and-limits.aspx  SUBSCRIBE!

value.title: Tooltips, tooltips, tooltips in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows how you can display multiple values within a tooltip for a visual. He walks through the DAX measure and also shows some pitfalls to look out for when it comes to filter context.  Go here for the sample DAX statement: https://guyinacube.com/2017/06/tooltips-tooltips-tooltips-power-bi/

value.title: Tracing Power BI with Fiddler
value.excerpt: I look at how you can use Fiddler to trace what is happening between your client machine and the Power BI Service.  This looks at the API's we use and what is returned. value.title: Tracing your DAX queries in Power BI

value.title: Upcoming EdX course on Analysis Services Tabular w/ Peter Myers (DAT225X)
value.excerpt: I met up with Peter Myers to talk about an upcoming EdX course for Analysis Services Tabular. He wrote and primarily presented the course which is free to you. You also have the option to upgrade to get a certificate of completion if you wish.  The course will be released on March 14, 2017 and is DAT225X.

value.title: Using Azure SQL Database Failover with Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how you can easily use Azure SQL Database Failover Groups with Power BI to ensure you have access to your data. Connecting to an Azure SQL Database Failover Group from Power BI is easier than connecting to a secondary replica of an Always On Availability Group.  LET'S

value.title: Using different languages with the Power BI site
value.excerpt: I look at how your browser languages affect what is displayed. This all comes down to your browsers and the language settings within. Different browsers are configured differently. Fiddler can show you what your language order is.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1

value.excerpt: Sharon asked a question about how to get started with OneDrive for Business and then use that with Power BI. value.title: Using Precedence to force Power BI Aggregations
value.excerpt: Are your Power BI Aggregations not matching? Setting Precedence can control which Power BI aggregation will be preferred. A little hint to help it on its way!
